rule.message: A view component should not be referenced in a model class
This class looks to be duplicated with a SDK class
rule.description: Monkey patching can be a risky undertaking because it is not using intended extensibility points and thus may have unintended consequences or make migration to newer versions of the SDK more difficult

rule.message: This class imports an internal class ({0}) from another function area ({1})
rule.description: If you have different functionalities, you probably don't want every class of each to be accessible from any other functional areas. So you probably want to use this packaging: [org].[project].func1.api [org].[project].func1.restricted [org].[project].func2.api [org].[project].func2.restricted This rule makes sure that no restricted classes is accessed from outside its own function area.

rule.message: There are more than 1 public variable in this MXML component
There are more than 2 public variables in this MXML component
This script block is too long ({0} maximum, but {1} actually)
Avoid using code behind files
rule.description: Code behind files are tightly coupled with the view, not unit-testable, not easy to navigate the code code base and not reusable. Try using presentation model pattern, or observer pattern

rule.message: BindingUtils class uses hard coded strings, which won't be picked up by the compiler if you rename this attribute. You should probably consider refactoring using events
ChangeWatcher class uses hard coded strings to specify the attribute name, to listen to. Prefer listening to events or setters
This binding expression is too long ({0} dots maximum, but {1} actually)
rule.description: A Binding expression is executed as soon as one of the bindable attributes changed. If a binding expression contains too many expression, there could be some performance issue.
rule.example: <mx:Label text="{ vfrfr.frfr.frf.lala }"/> <!-- Violation-->

rule.message: A modelLocator must not be Bindable at a class level
rule.description: A bindable ModelLocator could leads to performance issues due to bindings

rule.message: The ModelLocator should be only accessible from the main application file
rule.description: The ModelLocator should be only accessible from the main application file. Then sub-models should be injected to the nested views.

rule.message: A FrontController must nor add all its commands within the Controller constructor
rule.description: Try split them into methods where you add commands depending on their functional area.

rule.message: A Cairngorm event name should contain the function area name before the actual event name
rule.description: You would have something like 'productManagement.getProducts' as an event name.

rule.message: CairngormEventDispatcher is called explicitly. {0}
Only one reference of ModelLocator is allowed per class
Flex specific - Do not add or remove displayable children from updateDisplayList
rule.description: UpdateDisplayList is called everytime a child is invalidated. So calling addChild or removeChild in this function could be really CPU consuming

rule.message: Flex specific - Don't call 'callLater' explicitly
rule.description: If you needed to call 'callLater' explicitly, then you probably did not extend the correct component life cycle.

rule.message: The style block is embed in the MXML file
rule.description: It is not a good practice to embed style blocks inside the MXML component. Prefer using external CSS files.

rule.message: Embed metadata detected in source code where a stylesheet may be cleaner
This catch statement is empty
No statements in this if statement
rule.description: Empty If Statement finds instances where a condition is checked but nothing is done about it.

rule.message: The clone event must be overiden in a custom event
rule.description: Why do you need to override clone? Well, the clone method creates a copy of your event (or object - whatever object has the clone event; this isn't limited to Event objects). The default clone method inherited by the Event class or whatever class your custom class extends, will return an event object of the type of that class, not your custom event subclass. In the situations where a clone is needed, it is needed to be of the same type of your class, not the class it extends.

rule.message: No public variables should be inside a custom event. This variable ({0}) is public
rule.description: In order to improve encapsulation in your custom event, it is better not to have public variable in your event. Prefer having read-only attributes, set by the event constructor.

rule.message: An event is dispatched in a constructor
rule.description: This is pointless, since event listeners cannot be attached to an object before it has been constructed, so nothing can ever hear the event

rule.message: Event name should be set explicitly
DispatchEvent function must dispatch constant strings
rule.description: You should not dispatch a plain string. If you rename this string, you need to replace the string listener as well. Use constants instead

rule.message: addEventListener must not contain hard coded strings
rule.description: You should not listen for a plain string. If you rename this string, you need to replace the string listener as well. Use constants instead

rule.message: This type ({0}) is not found in the source path
This event type is not specified
rule.description: Specifying a type will allow Flash builder and the class to have this event exposed in its API

rule.message: Do not call Alert.show directly
rule.description: You should not Alert.show() directly. If an error occurred in the system, you should probably use an ErrorManager to have a consistent way to manage those errors.

rule.message: A high number of imports can indicate a high degree of coupling within an object. ({0} maximum but {1} actually)
rule.description: A high number of imports can indicate a high degree of coupling within an object. Rule counts the number of unique imports and reports a violation if the count is above the user defined threshold.

rule.message: This test contains a hard coded boolean value. You could remove it by having '{0}'
If this field ({0}) was meant to be a constant, make it constant. Otherwise, if it is used as a global variable, you may want to redesign this class
A class must not be dynamic
rule.description: When using dynamic classes, you cannot control how the developer will use your class. It makes refactoring really difficult

rule.message: Do not use Object class
rule.description: It is a bad practice to use the dynamic class Object. Prefer using strongly typed object, or marker interface in order to avoid silent compilation errors while refactoring

rule.message: Do not use Dictionnary class
rule.description: It is a bad practice to use the dynamic class Dictionary. Prefer using strongly typed object, or marker interface in order to avoid silent compilation errors while refactoring

rule.message: A constant field should be static ({0})
Use strongly typed objects instead of *
This method is empty. This should be removed ({0})
rule.description: This function is not needed.

rule.message: Protected accessors are useless in a final class. Make it private ({0})
You should not use the with keyword. It does not help readability
ArrayElementType metadata is not specified for this array-type field ({0})
The extension name is the same as the class name
This method ({0}) should be private
This statement is empty
This variable name is too short ({0} characters minimum, but {1} actually)
rule.description: Detects when a field, local, or parameter has a very short name.

rule.message: A package name should be lower case ({0})
rule.description: Detects when a package definition contains upper case characters.

rule.message: Using digits at the end of a symbol does not help understanging the meaning of it
A class property is hidden by this local variable ({0})
A class name must start by a majuscule character
This variable ({0}) seems to be incorrectly named. Let your creativity flow
A popup should not use dynamic filters
rule.description: Prefer using embed filters in assets

rule.message: This method is too complex. Maximum complexity is {0}, but its cyclomatic complexity was {1}
Constructor must be as lightweight as possible. No control statement allowed, whereas a cyclomatic complexe of {0} has been detected
rule.description: The Just-In-Time compiler does not compile constructors. Make them as lightweight as possible, or move the complexity of the code to a method called by the constructor. Then the complexity will be compiled by the JIT.

rule.message: creationPolicy to ALL impacts the performance significantly
Globally bindable classes can lead to unexpected behaviour especially when you have a setter to a property, and hits the performance of the application
Instanciating a variable in a loop can be expensive
Nested if statements are not a good design
Detect calls to the StyleManager that donâ€™t pass â€œfalseâ€ as the second parameter
rule.description: A recursive style manager call can be a very expensive operation, causing parts of the UI to flicker visibly. Instead it is preferable to defer the creation of parts of the UI that depend on a runtime CSS SWF until after the SWF has been loaded. In this case a recursive call is not required.

rule.message: Too many methods detected ({0} maximum, but {1} actually)
rule.description: A class with too many methods is probably a good suspect for refactoring, in order to reduce its complexity and find a way to have more fine grained objects.

rule.message: This function is far too long ({0} maximum, but {1} actually)
rule.description: Violations of this rule usually indicate that the method has too much responsibility. Try to reduce the method size by creating helper methods and removing any copy/pasted code.

rule.message: Long switch case detected ({0} lines maximum, but {1} actually)
rule.description: A switch case statement should be either empty, or contain a break, or call another method.

rule.message: Long parameter list detected ({0} maximum, but {1} actually)
rule.description: Long parameter lists can indicate that a new object should be created to wrap the numerous parameters. Basically, try to group the parameters together.

rule.message: Too much public fields or functions detected ({0} maximum, but {1} actually)
rule.description: A large number of public methods and attributes declared in a class can indicate the class may need to be broken up as increased effort will be required to thoroughly test it.

rule.message: Too many field detected ({0} maximum, but {1} actually)
rule.description: Classes that have too many fields could be redesigned to have fewer fields, possibly through some nested object grouping of some of the information. For example, a class with city/state/zipcode fields could instead have one Address field.

rule.message: Too many field detected ({0} maximum, but {1} actually)
A constructor should not have a return type
rule.description: Even if this is syntactically correct, there should not be a return type for a constructor.

rule.message: Too long line ({0} maximum, but {1} actually)
Imports from the same package are not necessary
The copyright header is missing in this file
The logger is not correctly formatted because {0}
A switch statement does not contain a default statement
rule.description: Switch statements should have a default label in order to detect corner cases.

rule.message: Switch must not be nested
rule.description: As a general practice, switch statement should not be used. Prefer using inheritance. It is even harder to read when switch statements are nested.

rule.message: There are too few branches in this switch statement ({0} minimum, but {1} actual)
rule.description: Switch statements are designed for complex branches, and allow branches to share treatment. Using a switch for only 2 branches is ill advised, as switches are not as easy to understand as if. In this case, it's most likely is a good idea to use a if statement

rule.message: Two switch cases should not be identical
A test should contain at least one assertion
This parameter ({0}) of this function is not used
This variable ({0}) is not used
This private method ({0}) does not seem to be used
This private attribute ({0}) does not seem to be used
This private method ({0}) is used but its content is empty
